wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Hugh Mackay Gordon (1760 – 12 March 1823) was a British Army officer who became Lieutenant Governor of Jersey.

response: *Hugh Gordon (British Army officer) (1760–1823), British Army lieutenant general

#Jane Mackay, who married Alexander Gordon from Fife  and had the following issue: Major Alexander Gordon of the 2nd Foot, Major George Gordon of the 8th West India Regiment, and Major Hugh Gordon of the 16th Foot and who was afterwards Lieutenant-General and  Governor of Jersey.
*Hugh Gordon (British Army officer) (1760–1823), British Army officer who became Lieutenant Governor of Jersey
*Hugh Gordon (violin maker) (1794–1854), violin maker from Northern Ireland
